str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
(a little boat, hence) a boat. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ploion; a boat.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From Tiberios; Tiberias, the name of a town and a lake in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
